name: Azara Kitchen LLC
address: 348 Lenox Ave, New York, NY 10027, USA

reviews.text: Perfect!
Our meal at this place was spectacular! This restaurant has earned its praise. Each time I visit, another menu item gets tasted. Welcoming staff members. Overall, it's outstanding and terrific !!!

My fianc√© and I were so excited to try this place. We saw reviews online stating that the food was delicious. We came in on Wednesday afternoon at about 5:45pm. There was only one other couple seated to eat. The waiters took our order. We initially ordered the Vegetable Nem as an appetizer, and also ordered our entrees at the same time. Literally 25 minutes goes by and the waitress tell us they are out of the Vegetable Nem‚Äî‚Äî why did it take so long to tell us idk. So we reluctantly ordered the Brussel sprouts ( i‚Äôm pescatarian). They arrived another 20 mins later‚Äî they were SOOOOOO BLAND. No seasoning at all and with a tiny dish of what tasted like French dressing. We already knew from then that everything was about to be below standard. About 15 mins after that the waitress brings my meal, and I at first refused to eat because my fianc√© didn‚Äôt receive his entree. After about 10 mins of me eating she comes over to use to confirm our orders‚Ä¶.and we have to remind her of what his meal is! I am sure she never put the order in. After my fianc√©‚Äôs insistence I eat so my food won‚Äôt get cold: I had the Atieke with fish. The meal was very subpar, flavors were off! I am Malian, I know my Atieke, this was NOT it. My fianc√©‚Äôs food literally come another 20 mins later. He was so disappointed in the lack of flavor. His meal - the Jollof Rice w/Lamb literally came with 3 chunks of lamb with only ONE having actual meat and the other two fatty pieces. The waitress was apologetic and she did offer us a complimentary Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e, which I mean was good- but not made fresh. I would NOT recommend this restaurant. We came all the way from Brooklyn to try it out left EXTREMELY DISSAPPOINTED. Don‚Äôt waste your TIME OR hard earned $$$$ in this economy.

soooo delicious!!! genuinely don‚Äôt think you can go wrong for the whole menu :) generous portions, great textures, amazing service! my personal favorites were the jollof rice with lamb and the fufu with okra stew & sauce clair
The food tasted amazing and the service was great
The food here is incredible! I am super picky when it comes to restaurants. Always perfectly cooked. My go to spot.

Their menu hits the mark with every dish they offer. The staff combines wit, warmth, and careful attention. They keep it tidy and charge fair rates. I've tried numerous dishes with consistent satisfaction. Find time to check this spot out.
Comida muy buena y el servicio super atento

My most recent stay in NYC saw me being guested by a childhood friend who lives in the old stomping grounds of Harlem, east through west, that I grew up in.

Though an attempt at gentrification ‚Äî that seems to have stalled a bit ‚Äî is detectable with the default introductions of homogenous staples such as Starbucks, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, et al, there are still homegrown, non-chain businesses that that have taken root and are starting to shine.

One of those places I discovered was directly across the street where I was Staying. It's called Azara Kitchen, and is the brainchild of Ousmane Compaore, chef and restauranteur from Burkina Faso.

The menu is touted as "African and Mediterranean" and boasts respectful representations of traditional dishes ‚Äî expertly prepared and and impressively delicious ‚Äî from those widespread and varied provenances.

In two nearly back-to-back visits, I was treated to a *maffe lamb* dinner dish of long-cooked on-the-bone lamb in an aromatically flavored peanut and vegetable broth, and followed that up with a booze-free version of tiramisu that finally offers my a more than rewarding opportunity to enjoy my second favorite dessert (after banana pudding) without the feel of sacrifice in taste or texture.

My second visit I was curious to to see how the globally ubiquitous chicken wings could stand out from the countless number of other iterations, and Azara's "spicy sticky" wings are uniquely seasoned and properly stand out from common wing editions by transporting the palate to places more exotic and authentic to the regions these globally individual flavor profiles get their inspirations from.

If I were still in the neighborhood, and possibly not even, Azara Kitchen, I would be a frequent visitor for not only the food and the obvious love that it comes from, but for the charming vibe and layout, accentuated by some well thought out wall art and an attentively pleasant staff.

(That charm made it easy to make new friends with some other diners that happened to be sitting next to me, a frequent reward of dining solo.)

Gentrification or not, Azara Kitchen should be a neighborhood standout that should continue being a rightful success for locals and visitors for a great many years.
Food is top tier. Came for brunch with my wife and we felt at home. 100% recommend.
Deliciousss! I got the jollof with fish and couldn‚Äôt get enough! Loved the cassava addition. Perfectly savory and spicy. Can‚Äôt wait to try more of their dishes soon

Amazing food and staff. Everything was amazing.
üëèü§© 10/10

The food was very good, but the service was slow. The waitress didn‚Äôt provide an itemized receipt at first, and when we requested one, it showed that a tip had already been included. She hadn‚Äôt mentioned this, which came across as a clear attempt to secure a double tip. That left a disappointing impression despite the quality of the food.

Great place to take your taste buds on a tour of west Africa without leaving Harlem. With a sprinkle of Italy as they have the most amazing tiramisu ive ever had. The restaurant is clean and well maintained. The staff is amazing and if you're lucky enough the founder of this gem and creator of the delicious menu will come out & great you himself. For a lil inspiration ask him to share his story. As an entrepreneur myself I love to hear others speak of their passion ‚ù§Ô∏è. & in this case the chef lights up like a star so you know the food is going to be good. Theres always R&B /afro beats playing in the background creating a great vibe . Perfect for friends gathering or family outing and casual dates. Or if your a home body order take out. My personal fav is Cassandra's Poisson which is
Grilled whole Branzino marinated with Azara's seasoning & served with grilled asparagus. Then for drinks I always get the ginger and the tamarind juice and mix them. Perfect half&half üëå
Absolutely delicious and flavourful food! The staff are also very friendly and attentive.

I ordered the Attieke Poisson and the fish was seasoned well, the plantains were delicious, and the couscous was ok, wish the was a special sauce the went with this dish. I also order the Maffe Lamb and there was only 3 pieces of lamb with bones in it. The meat to sauce ratio is not good and the lamb was kind of tough. I would eat here again but l would not order that tough lamb Maffe again.

Suya Ribeye was chopped up and overcooked (server never asked how I wanted it done, absolutely no juice/softness could be found). Jollof was dry as well, no sauce/oil/dressing to go with it.

There was no Air conditioning. Big loud fans to compensate. Front doors/windows open.

Flies everywhere. Probably because of the window/door situation.

They charged us for water. We asked for tap explicitly, they gave some explanation that Harlem tap isnt good. So you‚Äôre cooking with bad tap water but if we don‚Äôt pay for water we get none of it? Basically a scam.

Bathroom was filthy. Paper towels, toilet paper on the floor. Sink drain had paper in it, so sink was filling up.

Not a single apology or amends was made for the awful meal. The staff has the fake nice/plastic smile thing down as well.

I try not to leave reviews but it was so bad it feels like an injustice to not say something.
Truly worth coming back again. This spot has modern style and good hygiene. Besides that, personnel exhibited both kindness and accommodation. Their food makes you appreciate eating. Truly delicious.

Quaint little neighborhood spot that specializes in African food. There's a small breakfast menu which includes shrimp and grits and also pancakes, steak and eggs etc. Their coffee is great in addition to their service. Their food is good and the ambiance of the restaurant is great. Would recommend.

I came for the first time tonight and it was amazing! Wonderful, warm service DELICIOUS food, huge portions, and at a great price. My two friends and I ate two entree plates between us and still left with a to go plate.
The food was absolutely delicious and everyone was incredible and friendly. Thank you for having us!
Amazing food! Everything is so tasty, definitely coming back!

Mi sono fermato a pranzo con la mia famiglia. Il proprietario √© vissuto per diversi anni in Italia e parla benissimo l'italiano. Molto cortese e simpatico. Cibo ottimo e abbondante! Prezzi altrettanto ottimi e non turistici. Consigliatissimo per un buon pranzo nel cuore di Harlem!
lacked flavor, even the sauces.
I drive all the way from Queens for the food here. I LOVE the sauce claire and plantain fufu. Its crazy how is it so good? Matter fact, im coming here TADAY
Food and service was amazing. Had the creme br√ªl√©e and suya (grilled beef ribeye).
Nva heard of them, location is the same as Courtside Seafood Restaurant

Ein echtes Juwel in Harlem!

Azara Kitchen √ºberzeugt auf ganzer Linie: tolle Lage, au√üergew√∂hnlich sauber (selbst die Toilette ein Erlebnis!), angenehme Atmosph√§re mit leiser Musik im Hintergrund ‚Äì perfekt zum Genie√üen und Unterhalten.

Das Essen ist einfach sensationell: frisch, aromatisch, authentisch ‚Äì pure westafrikanische Genussmomente.

Ein besonderes Highlight: Fatou, unsere wundervolle Bedienung. Herzlich, aufmerksam, charmant ‚Äì sie hat den Abend mit ihrer warmen Art zu etwas ganz Besonderem gemacht. Eine echte Gastgeberin mit Herz!

Wer dem Trubel entfliehen und richtig gut essen m√∂chte, ist hier genau richtig.
Absolute Empfehlung. Wir kommen wieder!
the service was amazing but the food (lamb jollof) was way too salty.

It took me a while to visit this place, but I‚Äôm glad I did! The food is really good. I had the lamb mafe, my sister had fish with jollof rice, and we shared a side of sweet plantains.  My buddy, who is always watching his weight, had the salad. We all enjoyed our choices immensely, with my svelte friend being unable to resist, eating my food after tasting how good it was.
The prices are reasonable and the African decor is fresh and modern. It's BYOB, which is fine by me.
Azara is a nice-looking restaurant with friendly service. You should go.
You should go.

visited yesterday and the food was amazing. I got the dibi lamb with attieke and plantains while my guest had jollof rice with suya . both of our meals were sooo so good. server was so lovely and attentive. we also got some type of drink i don‚Äôt really remember the name but it had coconut and pineapple. it was amazing as well. 10/10 will be coming back
One of the cleanest African restaurant I have come across
This place was amazing!!! the employees were sooo kind, the food was so good, and the place is really clean. Also very reasonable prices!!
Nice restaurant with good service.
Best
Nice place
The food and the service is majestic
Excellent Attieke Poisson. Branzino fish was cooked well, couscous and veggie toppings were great, plantains also great
Great food and great service
The staff, food and music were amazing. Our waitress Fatou was very attentive and sweet. Definitely would recommend going there.
Best affordable authentic African cuisine.

Excellent--I'm very eager to come back here!  The Maffe Lamb was fantastic and the Antiekke Poisson amazed us both (and had a very generous helping of plaintains).  Service was a little slow on a Sunday afternoon, but the food was clearly‚Ä¶
Was so good and the food was filling definitely recommend.
A+ on everything, can‚Äôt recommend enough!!
Food was amazing. Service was great. Victoria made the experience very warm and welcoming. Will be back.
Vicky was awesome, her warm and welcoming demeanor made us feel.welcomed. the food was amazing as it was the 1st time having Jallof rice and lamb.
Queen Victoria was an amazing server and the food and fantastic!

Visiting from Dallas and my cousin recommended this place and the customer service from Vicky was amazing from the minute we walked in she greeted us with such a warm smile. The Watermelon mocktail was so refreshing, food was delicious we had the Chicken Alfredo and the Beef/ lamb nem and topped things off with the tiramisu. Highly recommend and looking forward to coming back next time I‚Äôm in the city!
The food is excellent and high quality. Ask for Vicky as your server when you go!

The food was amazing, service was great, and the portions were generous.
I had the lamb and friend plantain while my friends had the other meals in the photo.

The spice level was perfect, and can be increased as you please.

The fish and lamb were not deep fried like the usual practise is with their competitors.

Highly recommended if you‚Äôre visiting Harlem.

This place is definitely a hidden gem. According to our beautiful server, Tatiana, they've been open for about a year. Informed us that the chef was from Bakina Faso! üòÉ The food was absolutely the best. My man, Bocar, really set the tone and atmosphere for the place. Right there on Malcolm X Blvd ( Lennox Ave), the place was nicely decorated and very clean. You must try their house-made juices. The Baobab & Bissap, I tried, and they were delicious. They also have Ginger & Tamarind juices, as well. For entree, I had Cassandra's Poission, EXCELLENT. My wife and cousin had their Jolof Rice with Fish, EXCELLENT as well.The fish was Branzino cooked and seasoned to perfection! I will be back. üòãüòÉ

I had the steak sandwich at Azara Kitchen and it was absolutely delicious ‚Äî tender, flavorful, and cooked just right. Victoria, our server, was attentive, friendly, and added a personal touch that made the experience even better. Top-notch food and service ‚Äî can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Azara Kitchen is a must try establishment in the heart of Harlem! The food was delicious! The service was attentive. The atmosphere was a warm, chill, vibe.

We had the Jollof and Fish, the Spicy Wings and the Lamb. All of our dishes were seasoned and prepared to perfection! Full of aromatic flavors and the vegetables tasted fresh.

Our server offered recommendations on what to try. He kept the water flowing and even when we had a spill, he promptly mopped it up and brought over additional napkins.

The restaurant was a perfect casual date night spot as the lightening was more dim with candles on the table creating a romantic vibe.

We would definitely go back!!

First off,  this place is so clean the tile sparkles.  This was our first time eating West African food and the waitress was very helpful in explaining what everything was and helping us pick out flavors.
Everything we ordered was delicious, piping hot, and the portions were just right.  They will ask you "sparkling or still," just say tap. We made the mistake of thinking "still" was tap. We ended up paying for 2 fancy glass bottles of water.
In addition to coffee,  they sell very nice juices to go made in house.

Azara Kitchen blew me away! I was craving something different, and this spot delivered in every way. The blend of African and Mediterranean flavors is just perfect. every bite was packed with flavor! The spices were balanced, and the portions were generous. The staff made me feel right at home, too, with warm, friendly service. I can tell they put so much love into the food here. Definitely a new favorite ‚Äì if you haven‚Äôt been, you‚Äôre missing out!

This place is a vibe! Their Jollof is fire AND they have a vegan option and I didn‚Äôt even notice it was vegan. Staff and owner are super friendly and the food was really delicious. The plantains, on point, and I‚Äôm Dominican so y‚Äôall already know!  I‚Äôm so full but can‚Äôt stop eating. Loved it here. Recommend!

I came across this place while walking through the neighborhood. Chef and owner Ousmane was very welcoming and recommended some of the tastiest dishes on the menu. The vibe and the food were amazing! I will definitely be back here again soon.
I‚Äôm happy Azara was referred to me. I want fu fu and got much more! I was so hungry I forgot to take pics before we ateüòãüòÇ

Great place! It was such a surprise. I thought of going to Sylvia‚Äôs but wanted something different. Azara is just down the block from Sylvia‚Äôs and I‚Äôm glad I took a chance.  The food was a great combination of hearty and elegant. I had the avocado toast and my friend had the Jollof lamb. They were brilliant!  My friend lives in Harlem and didn‚Äôt know about this place. We‚Äôve decided this is going to be our go-to place from now on. We didn‚Äôt know about African food and now we love it. We got to talk with the chef Ousman and Sali and Alex - nice and professional and gracious. My friend called iood with love and care.

My new favorite West African restaurant in Harlem. I came here not knowing what to expect, but was extremely satisfied with the quality of food, the kindness of the owner, and the cleanliness of the restaurant. It‚Äôs a newer restaurant and things are still being figured out, so definitely cut them some slack as they start to add more options to their menu. Also shoutout to the jollof rice, it‚Äôs the best I‚Äôve had so far.

This is my first time trying West African food and it‚Äôs so good! Fufu is like mash potato, soft, tender and light. The cassava fufu is quite delightful, dipping into the flavorful stew is a perfect blend! The flavor profile is so new that I am loving it! The smoked fish is so so tasty!! The staff is so patient explaining how I should eat the fufu with my hand and I tried and completely failed. üòÜ but it tastes just as good with a spoon! ü•Ñ

Beautiful energy & decor. Amazing customer service. Kid friendly!!!! Flavor of food Is astounding üòç! My family gives 10 stars!!! Fast officiant service. Peaceful chill vibes
‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Very nice atmosphere and good food.
Style full African designed interior, maybe the light was a little too bright but the rest was absolutely perfect.

The server was knowledgeable, super friendly and explained everything we wanted to know.

The presentation of the dishes was everything! Original and style full. Like a gift that was presented to you.

I had the lamb with asperges as a side my friend the chicken with the joloff rice. We had bites of each other and we both loved both dishes. A number of times she said those asperges are so good! And boy did I enjoy the Joloff rice!

The restaurant is also kid friendly. There was a nice family next to us with a seat for the little one and we enjoyed chatting with them for a bit.

We had a great time. You could see and feel in everything that the owner, has a passion for what he does and takes his craft very serious.  A place I totally recommend.

Clean and welcoming place, had the food to-go. I got the beef fataya, of which the closest more recognizable item would be the Argentine empanada. I thought the flavor was decent and the dough was extra doughy which was good if heavy. I was more reminded also of Bengali shingaras, which are decent as long as not too heavy. I could've said more filling but actually as a snack it was fine.

I also got the dibi lamb. The lamb was way too dry, and the jollof rice was also dry. My guess is these were both made in much bigger batches, which is fine. But they were made with too little moisture to account for the loss of moisture when reheating. Put another way, the food was slightly nuked and that led to an oily dry lamb and a crumbly rice. I wonder what these would've been like fresh. For the dibi lamb, I looked this up because I was curious why the dish was so seemingly simple, and I think the mustard sauce is missing. Without it, this is a very oily stir fry, where the subtle flavors of classic Senegalese food are lost in the dense fat content.

Overall an OK place, I think if I go back I want to try one of their sandwiches, which should be less oily and thus more representative of what they're going for. Or I may just go for a snack and try their vibe as a reading/working place. But the mains are just not at the level I'd expect for Senegalese food in Harlem. Not yet, at least.

P.S. Actually, I wonder if it's the fish I should get, right ...
Make this place go viral! Great food, good vibez Awesome service! Nofy is the man, he took care of us and made our dining experience amazing. Shout outs to Azara kitchen keep it up.

The food was very good. The rice, cabbage, and fish was flavorful. The ambience is also very nice. My reasons for the 4 stars instead of 5- the quantity of food is less than I am use to especially African restaurants. The fish was pretty small for a dish that is pretty much $30. Beyond pouring water and bringing the food there is no further interaction or inquiry by the cashier/server. Regardless of those things I will definitely return.
Returned August 1th:
Just as before, the food was very good. I don‚Äôt realize that there is a plate where you can order an entire Bronzino fish if I want more fish. Beyond that I enjoyed the couscous made from cassava which I mixed with the pickled salad that I had. The plantains were cutting nice bite-size pieces and the pepper sauce added a nice flavorful kick to the fish. I ordered the tiramisu for dessert. It was OK but next time I‚Äôll try the red velvet.

A great little spot, extremely clean with great dishes. It‚Äôs about $20 a plate for lunch which is the higher end for this neighborhood, but the food was great and we‚Äôd happily be back. The chicken was really well seasoned, and the salad a healthy amount of dressing and parm - plenty of chicken! The jollof rice was delicious, and the lamb tender and well-cooked.
Super lieu : une belle d√©couverte merci √† Ousmane de nous avoir g√¢t√©s. Il rend bien hommage √† sa maman en l'honneur de qui il a baptis√© son restaurant.

10/10 this place is the best african spot in NYC! Food is amazing and full of flavors. Atmosphere is peaceful, chill vibes. Staff is friendly and good spirited and fun.‚ù§Ô∏èDefinitely check this place out! Music always on point

Stopped by this new restaurant not knowing what to expect and was pleasantly surprised. Right away you‚Äôll see the place is thoughtfully furnished and decorated, and the staff are all in uniform and very nice. They only had a limited ‚Äúsoft opening‚Äù menu and the only African dish I noticed was the Jolof rice which was delicious, as other reviewers have said. I was drawn in by the prospect of African food but was surprised to also see on the menu things like avocado toast, steak and eggs, salmon, Caesar salad, wings and other things you‚Äôd expect to see at many American fare restaurants. Although they did have plantains as a side dish which were also great (if you like them soft). Great service, great food, and I‚Äôm looking forward to when they start offering a full menu. Great addition to the neighborhood!

WARNING!!! Food poisoning risk at this restaurant.

I went to this restaurant because it looked super cute. The waiter was super sweet and I ordered the lamb egg rolls and enjoyed them while waiting for the jollof and fish to be completed. The jollof and fish tasted really good however it unfortunately gave me really bad food poisoning which I experienced while I was walking back home. This was my only meal for the day.

I immediately contacted the restaurant and the waiter took down my contact info and said the manager would call me back which did not happen. So I called back and had a polite conversation with the manager, I heard her bring this up to the owner and she asked what could be done on my behalf in which he said ‚Äúfood poisoning takes 1-3 days and is not immediate. And it is not the restaurants fault I got food poisoning. That is INCORRECT information because poisoning symptoms can start anywhere from 30 minutes to 3 weeks after eating contaminated food.

I‚Äôm posting this because hearing the owner take no responsibility was dismissive and more importantly I didn‚Äôt know going to his restaurant meant I would be given a laxative ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüòíüò©

It was a fun experience. I went with one other person and we both agreed it was pretty alright.

We shared beef and lamb nem as well as the Attieke Poisson. I also got a Baobab Juice.

The beef and lamb nem were alright. It was like a crispy roll with meat, vegs, and glass noodles inside. I thought the texture of the roll was perfect, but I didn't think the meat was savory enough to make me satisfied.

The Attieke Poisson was couscous, fried Branzino, salad and fried plantains.
The fried Branzino was done so well. The crust was delicious and had bite and flavor. It paired so well with the fish. I wish the fish was cut length wise along the spine instead of width wise to make it easier to work around the bones. Just a couple of cuts around the fish mightve made it a more comfortable dining experience.

The couscous I thought was a bit strange. It was kinda dry and pretty acidic. I'm not too sure what it was supposed to be eaten with too.

The little salad was fine, but it was sitting in a bowl of oil which felt unhealthy to me. I'm not sure if it really added much to the experience but calories.

The fried plantains were done to what I'd expect of them.

The Baobab Juice was so good! It was a thick refreshing liquid with some tang. I love the texture of it. A little like a smoothie.

I ate here months ago and the food was good, which is why I'm giving them 2 stars instead of 1. A few days ago I went there again and the food (rice and fish) was so salty it was barely edible. Also the service is extremely slow and lackadaisical. I'll give them another chance but they need to get it together. Les Ambassades over on Frederick is way more consistent and better.
Ordered the fish with jollaf which was really good! The scotch bonnet sauce on the side was amazing

I love this place so much! Everything on the menu is wonderful. The people in here make everything so much better! The experience was so wonderful for my first time. Special shout outs to Ousmane the owner and Kojo. They treat you like family, the vibes are immaculate. I will definitely be back and bring all my friends and family. I had the grilled branzino, the fufu, the souya and attieke. Nothing you order will dissappoint , I didnt want to leave!

Excellent shrimps and grits! Their lamb is good too. One of our party of 3 has tight lunchtime (our bad) and really appreciate the gentleman server‚Äôs attentive service. Food presentation is good and portions are generous. Will come back for sure!

I highly recommend!!! Cozy, elegant, inviting, tasty, flavorful, affordable  restaurant. The food was seasoned and prepared with love. The atmosphere was lively and bright. Black owned restaurant in the heart of Harlem. Definitely check them out I throughly enjoyed my fufu.
